pullRequest.body:
Introduces `Scheme.Hom.stalkMap` and `LocallyRingedSpace.Hom.stalkMap` with the API copied from presheafed spaces. Removes `LocallyRingedSpace.stalk` and `LocallyRingedSpace.ΓToStalk`. Instead uses `Presheaf.stalk` and `Presheaf.germ` directly.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

The intent is to get rid of `erw`s when working with stalks on schemes. Especially composition of stalk maps caused issues before.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Scheme.arrowStalkMapSpecIso`
`+ Scheme.iso_hom_val_base_inv_val_base`
`+ Scheme.iso_hom_val_base_inv_val_base_apply`
`+ Scheme.iso_inv_val_base_hom_val_base`
`+ Scheme.iso_inv_val_base_hom_val_base_apply`
`+ Scheme.localRingHom_comp_stalkIso`
`+ germ_stalkIso_hom'`
`+ germ_stalkIso_inv`
`+ instance (x : X) : LocalRing (X.presheaf.stalk x)`
`+ instance {X Y : LocallyRingedSpace.{u}} (f : X ⟶ Y) (x : X) : IsLocalRingHom (f.stalkMap x)`
`+ iso_hom_val_base_inv_val_base`
`+ iso_hom_val_base_inv_val_base_apply`
`+ iso_inv_val_base_hom_val_base`
`+ iso_inv_val_base_hom_val_base_apply`
`+ map_germ_eq_Γgerm`
`+ ofRestrict_stalkMap_isIso`
`+ restrictStalkIso`
`+ restrictStalkIso_hom_eq_germ`
`+ restrictStalkIso_hom_eq_germ_apply`
`+ restrictStalkIso_inv_eq_germ`
`+ restrictStalkIso_inv_eq_germ_apply`
`+ restrictStalkIso_inv_eq_ofRestrict`
`+ Γgerm`
`+ Γgerm_res_apply`
`++ Hom.stalkMap`
`++ stalkMap_comp`
`++ stalkMap_congr`
`++ stalkMap_congr_hom`
`++ stalkMap_congr_point`
`++ stalkMap_germ`
`++ stalkMap_germ'`
`++ stalkMap_germ'_apply`
`++ stalkMap_germ_apply`
`++ stalkMap_hom_inv`
`++ stalkMap_hom_inv_apply`
`++ stalkMap_id`
`++ stalkMap_inv_hom`
`++ stalkMap_inv_hom_apply`
`++ stalkSpecializes_stalkMap`
`++ stalkSpecializes_stalkMap_apply`
`+-- stalkMap`
`- instance (x : X) : LocalRing (X.stalk x)`
`- instance {X Y : LocallyRingedSpace.{u}} (f : X ⟶ Y) (x : X) : IsLocalRingHom (stalkMap f x)`
`- stalk`
`- stalkLocal`
`- ΓToStalk`
`- ΓToStalk_stalkMap`
`- ΓToStalk_stalkMap_apply`
`-++-+ stalk_iso`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/6f3d590f-9a7a-4f52-a6ed-ed7c409f11f2) for commit d34981bd4a5c3a7addac5234489597aa5e6d6fec.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/17e9d8b8-72da-44b2-8924-08d8769c1707/to/6f3d590f-9a7a-4f52-a6ed-ed7c409f11f2) against commit df0b4dd7c1ca19a2861ca6ec1bd63851cb6037e9:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme                  instructions    15.2%
- ~Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.LocallyRingedSpace   instructions    31.7%
```

> Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/6f3d590f-9a7a-4f52-a6ed-ed7c409f11f2) for commit [d34981b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/d34981bd4a5c3a7addac5234489597aa5e6d6fec). There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/17e9d8b8-72da-44b2-8924-08d8769c1707/to/6f3d590f-9a7a-4f52-a6ed-ed7c409f11f2) against commit [df0b4dd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/df0b4dd7c1ca19a2861ca6ec1bd63851cb6037e9):
> 
> ```diff
>   Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
>   ========================================================================
> - ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme                  instructions    15.2%
> - ~Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.LocallyRingedSpace   instructions    31.7%
> ```

I _think_ these are okay, since quite a few lemmas are added to these two files. @mattrobball what do you think?
(btw: I am not sure why the bot does not remove the `merge-conflict` label)
I think the increases are mostly due to the set of simp theorems about equivalences. Where are these needed?

> I think the increases are mostly due to the set of simp theorems about equivalences. Where are these needed?

The general ones are used in `stalkMap_hom_inv` and co, which are not used in this PR, but which come up from time to time and are certainly annoying to prove on the fly.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/81b5d5fe-1bda-45a3-9c37-a28a33bc017e) for commit 8ea5e0e438d0b000738e7c39c76c8ca53162448d.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/81b5d5fe-1bda-45a3-9c37-a28a33bc017e) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.AffineScheme            instructions    11.7%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme                  instructions    22.3%
- ~Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.LocallyRingedSpace   instructions    34.2%
```
(For the record, Christian is on holiday and I'm taking over)
bors merge
@mattrobball I'd like to try writing the `elementwise` lemmas by hand. They use `ConcreteCategory.instFunLike` instead of the right `funlike` instance so should probably be rewritten anyways.
bors r-
Canceled.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/95e1678b-e0bd-47f3-b82d-51e1a6828170) for commit 7cd281a4ecff18f4d230a208bcb908a2a6c9dc2a.

```diff

There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/7b9c81f8-abb2-4cc1-a169-44d32624dd5d) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1:

There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/28ddfc07-a875-4ad7-bfa7-4aed0f6fd010) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1:

```

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/f4abe8f4-7b94-4953-8a0c-59be00bc8c33) for commit f57523a681359260e04bbc58642bcb21f68d291e.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/3d6b3524-779c-4a17-aa18-8105e052846a) for commit 77dbf75d1332aff84d199702b172e7c11ffde98d.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/3d6b3524-779c-4a17-aa18-8105e052846a) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/4cc3937f-9a96-4bf0-8e33-1f4df3eff9cc) for commit e16ec2d7cf68c4fc600eff444f2c212b9d1b1245.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/4cc3937f-9a96-4bf0-8e33-1f4df3eff9cc) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b55115a6-a51b-4695-9cce-53d8e4a416ff) for commit 3d62ca5bcf5547066f822f7614c5467331b538c4.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/b55115a6-a51b-4695-9cce-53d8e4a416ff) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/d2835a2d-2a13-4f69-bedc-79de3a2f4554) for commit 859763d20c5463cca94121d53eb2440c9294d11b.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/d2835a2d-2a13-4f69-bedc-79de3a2f4554) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.LocallyRingedSpace   instructions    25.3%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/f862bfa4-5f4b-4122-b692-9a13c556a15c) for commit ef954a2745b8ac4af7924abab3506ee547f2a64a.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/f862bfa4-5f4b-4122-b692-9a13c556a15c) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.LocallyRingedSpace   instructions    25.3%
```
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/58cc51a3-201e-46c1-9e40-e71a3a31d956) for commit fb3c77d3d2a71f58d75ad87b1ba9ba5339e7b3cb.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/58cc51a3-201e-46c1-9e40-e71a3a31d956) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.LocallyRingedSpace   instructions    25.3%
```

I have given up. I tried various hacks that seems to improve the runtime on my local machine but the slow down is still there. @mattrobball if you are interested please give it a look. If not I think let's just merge it.

Can you summarize any observations? It is hard to track from the git log. Also, you can use `time -v lake env lean --profile XX/YY/ZZ.lean` on your machine to get statistics for your file. This is helpful so you don't have to wait for `!bench`

So by the bench [before](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15070#issuecomment-2252192141) and [after](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15070#issuecomment-2252332931) the commit [859763](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15070/commits/859763d20c5463cca94121d53eb2440c9294d11b), one can see that `stalkMap_germ'_apply` is single-handedly responsible for the +25% slowdown. I've tried various methods (providing types to arguments, filling in implicit variables by hand) that speeds up the elaboration time of that lemma from 2s to 1s on my local machine, but it doesn't seem to affect anything.

And the command is useful. Thanks! I didn't know about the `--profile` flag. I guess I can experiment some more now.
It doesn't give me instruction count though. Can I somehow get that locally?
Maybe. I don't know how and use CPU time as a proxy there. It is fairly stable on your own machine.
Yeah but I don't seem to see the +25% instructions (or +25% cpu time) that I'm supposed to see.
Odd. I can see the different between this branch and master on my machine. I will poke slightly and then merge
[Here is a gist](https://gist.github.com/mattrobball/8a377f332566c085136e98956172a647) of one example of the problem.

Yes they are needed regardless.
I suspect unbundling `TopCat.Presheaf.germ` so that there is no coercion in the signature might help. I might try that next.
Any other changes anyone wants before it is merged?
I think it's good to go. Christian is on vacation.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10149800402/job/28065502380)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10149800402/job/28065503257)
Thanks for doing this!
LGTM thanks!
What's this?
A forgotten leftover, I already deleted it.

```suggestion
@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
```

```suggestion
@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
```

```suggestion
@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
theorem germ_res (F : X.Presheaf C) {U V : Opens X} (i : U ⟶ V) (x : U) :
```

```suggestion
@[reassoc]
lemma Γgerm_res (F : X.Presheaf C) {U : Opens X} {i : U ⟶ ⊤} (x : U) :
```
I think calling it `map_germ_eq_Γgerm` is more predictable.
I'm not sure we should have this. The intent is to only use `TopCat.Presheaf.stalkCongr`.

The LHS can appear in proof terms though, even if using `TopCat.Presheaf.stalkCongr` as much as possible. So I think it is still useful, but I don't think I actually use it elsewhere in this PR. So if you insist, I remove it.
Are there any examples? In theory we shouldn't have any `X.stalk a = X.stalk b` appearing in proof terms as they are equalities of types and are evil.

I had one when preparing this PR, but later found a different solution, I can't find the example now. Let me remove this and if it reappears, I give you the example.

Re: No `X.stalk a = X.stalk b`. That is not what appears here though, right? The lemma is about comparing the maps `F.germ x` and `F.germ x'`.
The `(by rw [h])` part is `X.stalk a = X.stalk b` I think.
What's with the `CategoryStruct.comp` here? Maybe use `CommRingCat.ofHom` instead?
Yes, that fixed it. (I copied this from somewhere)
Or maybe there are better formalizations of the LHS of `Scheme.localRingHom_comp_stalkIso` that gets rid of these?
I got rid of the `erw`s, but with a different technique that I think is more useful in general.

```suggestion
    fun ⟨h₁, h₂⟩ => @IsOpenImmersion.of_stalk_iso _ _ f h₁ h₂⟩
```
This is already present on line 61 right? Not sure why we had it twice...
Removed it.
Should the RHS of these be stated in terms of `TopCat.Presheaf.stalkCongr` instead? @erdOne
Yes.
I did state things in terms of `stalkSpecializes` as that's what `stalkCongr.hom` simps to.
If you want access to the dot notation, can this just be an `abbrev`?

I thought the principle is to hide the implementation detail that schemes are implemented as presheafed spaces as much as possible, so we mostly mirror the API. Do you think performance is better if this is an `abbrev`?

```suggestion
lemma Scheme.localRingHom_comp_stalkIso {R S : CommRingCat.{u}} (f : R ⟶ S) (p : PrimeSpectrum S) :
```
New uses `elementwise` seem to be responsible for about half the regression.
Similarly here there is a surprising penalty for this.
Do you mean the existence of the simp lemmas slow things down or the generation of the simp lemmas are slow? I'll try to generate them by hand if it is the latter.
I think this PR is fine. But someone should look at `elementwise`. I suspect it is doing too much `simp` in its internals.
I am not a big fan of the `Hom` hack here. I think this should be brought up with core but shouldn't hold the PR back.
What do you mean by the `Hom` hack? Do you mean using `(f : Hom X Y)` instead of `(f : X ⟶ Y)` to make dot notation work?
Yes
I'm not that happy about it too. "`Quiver.Hom` is a semireducible def so it is unreasonable to tell the dot notation to see through it". This is the answer I got the last time I asked.

For the record, this is the culprit of the slow down.
Still trying to figure out why. This isn't particularly slow on my machine.
(or maybe the last lemma)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(AlgebraicGeometry): stalk maps

> ```

I _think_ these are okay, since quite a few lemmas are added to these two files. @mattrobball what do you think?
(btw: I am not sure why the bot does not remove the `merge-conflict` label)
I think the increases are mostly due to the set of simp theorems about equivalences. Where are these needed?

> I think the increases are mostly due to the set of simp theorems about equivalences. Where are these needed?

The general ones are used in `stalkMap_hom_inv` and co, which are not used in this PR, but which come up from time to time and are certainly annoying to prove on the fly.
!bench
LGTM thanks!

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/81b5d5fe-1bda-45a3-9c37-a28a33bc017e) for commit 8ea5e0e438d0b000738e7c39c76c8ca53162448d.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/ddd56ed0-019d-4ba4-8636-de3067f78218/to/81b5d5fe-1bda-45a3-9c37-a28a33bc017e) against commit 4261f9948f9b3a34788207657c661fe9f6c226b1:
```diff
  Benchmark                                          Metric         Change
  ========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.AffineScheme            instructions    11.7%
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme                  instructions    22.3%
- ~Mathlib.Geometry.RingedSpace.LocallyRingedSpace   instructions    34.2%
```
(For the record, Christian is on holiday and I'm taking over)
bors merge
@mattrobball I'd like to try writing the `elementwise` lemmas by hand. They use `ConcreteCategory.instFunLike` instead of the right `funlike` instance so should probably be rewritten anyways.
bors r-
Canceled.
!bench

I have given up. I tried various hacks that seems to improve the runtime on my local machine but the slow down is still there. @mattrobball if you are interested please give it a look. If not I think let's just merge it.

Can you summarize any observations? It is hard to track from the git log. Also, you can use `time -v lake env lean --profile XX/YY/ZZ.lean` on your machine to get statistics for your file. This is helpful so you don't have to wait for `!bench`

So by the bench [before](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15070#issuecomment-2252192141) and [after](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15070#issuecomment-2252332931) the commit [859763](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15070/commits/859763d20c5463cca94121d53eb2440c9294d11b), one can see that `stalkMap_germ'_apply` is single-handedly responsible for the +25% slowdown. I've tried various methods (providing types to arguments, filling in implicit variables by hand) that speeds up the elaboration time of that lemma from 2s to 1s on my local machine, but it doesn't seem to affect anything.

And the command is useful. Thanks! I didn't know about the `--profile` flag. I guess I can experiment some more now.
It doesn't give me instruction count though. Can I somehow get that locally?
Maybe. I don't know how and use CPU time as a proxy there. It is fairly stable on your own machine.
Yeah but I don't seem to see the +25% instructions (or +25% cpu time) that I'm supposed to see.
Odd. I can see the different between this branch and master on my machine. I will poke slightly and then merge
[Here is a gist](https://gist.github.com/mattrobball/8a377f332566c085136e98956172a647) of one example of the problem.

Yes they are needed regardless.
I suspect unbundling `TopCat.Presheaf.germ` so that there is no coercion in the signature might help. I might try that next.
Any other changes anyone wants before it is merged?
I think it's good to go. Christian is on vacation.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.
